Cheers! Looks great.
Can anyone help with my glitch?

It's not working for me either.

My parts list (For all categories) is empty, and the tag editor as well. It did detect correctly all the plugins I have though..

Basically my observations are as follows:

- Start game, go to VAB. Parts Catalog Config menu comes up. I don't change anything, and just close the dialog.

- Parts Catalog menu is visible. I can selekt KW Rocketry, AIES etc... All my mods appear to be there. Good.

- When I select hwever in a particular mod a particular category nothing happens. What I expected to happen is for the parts list to be filtered. This is not happening.

- I select one pod to start my ship, and the moment I do this all parts in all categories disappear. Nothing I do makes them come back.

- I try tag editor, but this is completely empty...

SO as of the moment I will remove this again, as it doesn't do anything, and makes gameplay impossible.

This is on 0.22, on a mac, with quite a few mods though...

I have the same problem. I really need this mod because I have so many parts ItÃ‚Â´s very difficult to find the part I need ^^

Hopefully this issue will be solved. 0.22 on Windows 7 Ultimate and every mod from here
Do you guys have the 0.22 hotfix? It works perfectly for me

It's not working for me either.

My parts list (For all categories) is empty, and the tag editor as well. It did detect correctly all the plugins I have though..

Basically my observations are as follows:

- Start game, go to VAB. Parts Catalog Config menu comes up. I don't change anything, and just close the dialog.

- Parts Catalog menu is visible. I can selekt KW Rocketry, AIES etc... All my mods appear to be there. Good.

- When I select hwever in a particular mod a particular category nothing happens. What I expected to happen is for the parts list to be filtered. This is not happening.

- I select one pod to start my ship, and the moment I do this all parts in all categories disappear. Nothing I do makes them come back.

- I try tag editor, but this is completely empty...

SO as of the moment I will remove this again, as it doesn't do anything, and makes gameplay impossible.

This is on 0.22, on a mac, with quite a few mods though...

Same exact problem, I have tons of mods, Mac, everything.

Peruse this thread, the OP posted a hotfix for 0.22. It's NOT on the main page. So you have to go through a few pages of comments.

Without the hotfix, it just won't work as described above by a few of you. You NEED the hotfix.

Cheers,

For everyone who's lost without the catalog, here's a hotfix to make it work under 0.22.

I'm currently incorperating some bigger bugfixes regarding losing the catalog, as well as implementing some new features.

Here it is folks!

Here it is folks!

There are no words to express how much I love you right now

Here it is folks!

Thank you very much
Auto-tag appears to not work with 0.23. The only tag it creates is "All".

the dev hasn't been around since 0.22 came out, so who knows if there's gonna be one
Jeez, and no can take over unless he gives permission.

the dev hasn't been around since 0.22 came out, so who knows if there's gonna be one

Cheers,

Jeez, and no can take over unless he gives permission.

He already gave permission by using the CC-SA license.
Missed that. Great, I already PM'ed him with that error. I hope someone will come take over, then.

Jesus... New KSP versions was released and two days later people want others to take over your projects...

Don't worry I'm still around, reading up on everything here just got painfully little time with my university exams and moving to a new flat and whatnot.

I'll have a look into this later today, I need it just as much to play KSP as do you guys, don't forget that.

Also judging from the cludges I made to get this whole thing going... Poor soul who'd want to take this project over
